MONL.content: vision of the New International w/ every word
MONL.linkedContent: vision of the New International w/ every word

SPOM.content: the “communism” we will nickname new International: l'alliance d'un rejoindre sans conjoint, sans organisation, sans parti, sans nation, sans État, sans propriété > w/out effacing heterogeneity of the other, sans blesser la dis-jointure [see POOF pp. 54-5]
SPOM.linkedContent: the “communism” we will nickname new International: l'alliance d'un rejoindre sans conjoint, sans organisation, sans parti, sans nation, sans État, sans propriété > w/out effacing heterogeneity of the other, sans blesser la dis-jointure [see POOF pp. 54-5]

SPOM.content: subtitle of SPOM: “the New International” (not necessarily ant-statist)
“New International”: untimely link, w/out title, w/out name, contract, w/out party, w/out national community…friendship of an alliance w/out institution
SPOM.linkedContent: “New International”: untimely link, w/out title, w/out name, contract, w/out party, w/out national community…friendship of an alliance w/out institution

SPOM.content: New International belongs only to anonymity, New Enlightenment for the century to come
SPOM.linkedContent: New International belongs only to anonymity, New Enlightenment for the century to come

SPOM.content: watch over a future in memory, this time, of an impure “impure impure history of ghosts”
SPOM.linkedContent: watch over a future in memory, this time, of an impure “impure impure history of ghosts”

SPOM.content: “intellectual” of tomorrow, “scholar” of future should learn justice from the ghost, should learn to speak to the ghost (if even in the other w/in oneself)
SPOM.linkedContent: “intellectual” of tomorrow, “scholar” of future should learn justice from the ghost, should learn to speak to the ghost (if even in the other w/in oneself)

POR.content: for Aristotle, human distinguished from animals who have hard, dry eyes (tōn sklerophtalmōn), who alway see
POR.linkedContent: for Aristotle, human distinguished from animals who have hard, dry eyes (tōn sklerophtalmōn), who alway see

POR.content: Derrida wants to cultivate a new university Enlightenment, but also insists University must not be a scleropthalmic animal [must go dark, blink]
POR.linkedContent: Derrida wants to cultivate a new university Enlightenment, but also insists University must not be a scleropthalmic animal [must go dark, blink]

POR.content: [re: CIPH] new responsibility of community of thought w/out secured frontier btwn basic & end-oriented research (entre recherche fondamentale et recherche finalisée) > rethink community, institution, and all ruses, tâche infinie, de la raison finalisante > paths by which apparently disinterested research can by reinvested by all sorts of programs
POR.linkedContent: [re: CIPH] new responsibility of community of thought w/out secured frontier btwn basic & end-oriented research (entre recherche fondamentale et recherche finalisée) > rethink community, institution, and all ruses, tâche infinie, de la raison finalisante > paths by which apparently disinterested research can by reinvested by all sorts of programs

POR.content: strategic rhythm of new [professorial?] responsibility: multiple sites (lieux), rhythm of blinking eye (d’un battement de paupières), play one risk off other, la clôture contre l’abîme, l’abîme contre la clôture [hard eye (of reason) has no rhythm, no heart beat, no arrêt of sur-vie]
POR.linkedContent: strategic rhythm of new [professorial?] responsibility: multiple sites (lieux), rhythm of blinking eye (d’un battement de paupières), play one risk off other, la clôture contre l’abîme, l’abîme contre la clôture [hard eye (of reason) has no rhythm, no heart beat, no arrêt of sur-vie]

POR.content: protocols of vigilance for new Aufklärung: beware the abysses and gorges, but also the bridges & barriers, beware of opening university to bottomless outside or closing it in on itself so that it is available to any interest, or becomes useless > beware of ends, university w/out ends?
POR.linkedContent: protocols of vigilance for new Aufklärung: beware the abysses and gorges, but also the bridges & barriers, beware of opening university to bottomless outside or closing it in on itself so that it is available to any interest, or becomes useless > beware of ends, university w/out ends?

EM.content: national philosophical identity accommodates a nonidentity
EM.linkedContent: national philosophical identity accommodates a nonidentity

FWT.content: Derrida’s new International to fight 10 wounds of new world order: unemployment, exclusion of exiles, economic wars, arms trade, ethnic conflict (based on soil & blood), power of phantom states in form of mafias and drug cartels
FWT.linkedContent: Derrida’s new International to fight 10 wounds of new world order: unemployment, exclusion of exiles, economic wars, arms trade, ethnic conflict (based on soil & blood), power of phantom states in form of mafias and drug cartels

FWT.content: there’s necessity for secondary effects of program (programmatic economy & strategy), but in the first/last instance, what is to be done is invented/inaugurated, must come w/out program
FWT.linkedContent: there’s necessity for secondary effects of program (programmatic economy & strategy), but in the first/last instance, what is to be done is invented/inaugurated, must come w/out program

FWT.content: New International must seek unheard of figures [I cannot define this form], not opposed to existence of parties, but “Party” form is no longer the major form of political struggle
FWT.linkedContent: New International must seek unheard of figures [I cannot define this form], not opposed to existence of parties, but “Party” form is no longer the major form of political struggle

FWT.content: “new International” an engagement btwn men, btwn living beings (w/ “animals”!), btwn living & dead, and those not yet born
FWT.linkedContent: “new International” an engagement btwn men, btwn living beings (w/ “animals”!), btwn living & dead, and those not yet born

FWT.content: some citizen identity is necessary, but categorical imperative exceeds responsibility of citizen as such
FWT.linkedContent: some citizen identity is necessary, but categorical imperative exceeds responsibility of citizen as such

POOF.content: no enlightenment, for us, except the one to come (to be thought) [i.e. “community w/out community]
POOF.linkedContent: no enlightenment, for us, except the one to come (to be thought) [i.e. “community w/out community]

PSSS.content: political force of psychoanalysis remains at odds w/ res publica, or even democracy of sovereignist concept (nation-statist), and at odds w/ publicity of its own institutionalization
PSSS.linkedContent: political force of psychoanalysis remains at odds w/ res publica, or even democracy of sovereignist concept (nation-statist), and at odds w/ publicity of its own institutionalization

PSSS.content: cruel mutation of cruelty: a technical, scientific, juridical, economic, ethical, political, and terrorist policing mutation of our age
PSSS.linkedContent: cruel mutation of cruelty: a technical, scientific, juridical, economic, ethical, political, and terrorist policing mutation of our age

PSSS.content: must think a mutation of cruelty, more pscyhoanlaytico; new historical figures of an ageless cruelty, older than man
PSSS.linkedContent: must think a mutation of cruelty, more pscyhoanlaytico; new historical figures of an ageless cruelty, older than man

PSSS.content: think limit/horizon of psychoanalysis (yet to be thought)
PSSS.linkedContent: think limit/horizon of psychoanalysis (yet to be thought)

PSSS.content: an outside psychoanalysis (ethics, politics) should account for psychoanalytic knowledge while maintaining heterogeneity of the leap [account for knowledge w/out seeking program]
PSSS.linkedContent: an outside psychoanalysis (ethics, politics) should account for psychoanalytic knowledge while maintaining heterogeneity of the leap [account for knowledge w/out seeking program]

PSSS.content: a task w/out horizon for a new psychoanalytic Enlightenment: will calculate w/ the inflexible unconditionality of the unconditional [think POOF, counting event of friendship]
PSSS.linkedContent: a task w/out horizon for a new psychoanalytic Enlightenment: will calculate w/ the inflexible unconditionality of the unconditional [think POOF, counting event of friendship]

LI.content: margin, parasite, iterability belong w/out belonging to the class of concepts of which they must render an accounting—to theoretical space they organize in a “quasi”-transcendental manner: something happens by or to set theory > all this must be rendered (rendre compte et raison) by us enlightened modern thinkers, right?
LI.linkedContent: margin, parasite, iterability belong w/out belonging to the class of concepts of which they must render an accounting—to theoretical space they organize in a “quasi”-transcendental manner: something happens by or to set theory > all this must be rendered (rendre compte et raison) by us enlightened modern thinkers, right?

LI.content: absence of univocal definitions not “obscurantist” but a new, very new Aufklärung
LI.linkedContent: absence of univocal definitions not “obscurantist” but a new, very new Aufklärung

TN.content: Nancy on Enlightenment to come: never renounce thought, philosophy, knowledge > Nancy never renounces pertinence, he is so resolute, even at heart of ecstasy, of sacrifice
TN.linkedContent: Nancy on Enlightenment to come: never renounce thought, philosophy, knowledge > Nancy never renounces pertinence, he is so resolute, even at heart of ecstasy, of sacrifice

WOG.content: “one must never give up on analysing and explaining the resemblances, the ‘common genre,’ the analogies and commonalities” [re: society, history, politics]
WOG.linkedContent: “one must never give up on analysing and explaining the resemblances, the ‘common genre,’ the analogies and commonalities” [re: society, history, politics]

WOG.content: exploring these resemblances one task of Enlightenment of our time, even if not most important or urgent, even if our categories for configuration are radically insufficient > we must take account as well the fractures & anachronisms of resemblance: truth of homology best imposed by going through differences that blur one’s vision
WOG.linkedContent: exploring these resemblances one task of Enlightenment of our time, even if not most important or urgent, even if our categories for configuration are radically insufficient > we must take account as well the fractures & anachronisms of resemblance: truth of homology best imposed by going through differences that blur one’s vision

EU.content: Derrida continues to believe in the interest in light re: university, a task that remains for us given-to (donné-à), to what I don’t know (one might have once said: to doing or thinking)
EU.linkedContent: Derrida continues to believe in the interest in light re: university, a task that remains for us given-to (donné-à), to what I don’t know (one might have once said: to doing or thinking)

EU.content: interpretation of poem, philosopheme, theologeme always proposes an institutional model, consolidating an existing one or constituting a new one: calls for politics of community of interpreters > every text/element of corpus bequeathes/reproduces several injunctions
EU.linkedContent: interpretation of poem, philosopheme, theologeme always proposes an institutional model, consolidating an existing one or constituting a new one: calls for politics of community of interpreters > every text/element of corpus bequeathes/reproduces several injunctions

EU.content: every text opens/closes, double bind, undecidability, an overdetermination that can’t be mastered
EU.linkedContent: every text opens/closes, double bind, undecidability, an overdetermination that can’t be mastered

EU.content: [structure of matrix of philosophical discipline] is a “nondialectizable” contradiction, divided law, double law, double bind, antinomy: the fights/debates we’re talking about always oppose different philosophies
EU.linkedContent: [structure of matrix of philosophical discipline] is a “nondialectizable” contradiction, divided law, double law, double bind, antinomy: the fights/debates we’re talking about always oppose different philosophies

EU.content: Husserl’s transcendental community of “we” in face of “crisis” & Heidegger’s call of Being comprises, pre-comprehends, us—so we begin w/ them & otherwise: 1st commandment: 2 ends: the cheap end, the Kantian end 2nd commandment: local, ubiquity 3rd commandment: teach, not teach 6th commandment: time requirements, and “single blow (tout à coup)” 7th commandment: place, non-place
EU.linkedContent: Husserl’s transcendental community of “we” in face of “crisis” & Heidegger’s call of Being comprises, pre-comprehends, us—so we begin w/ them & otherwise: 1st commandment: 2 ends: the cheap end, the Kantian end 2nd commandment: local, ubiquity 3rd commandment: teach, not teach 6th commandment: time requirements, and “single blow (tout à coup)” 7th commandment: place, non-place

EU.content: only livable community (for Derrida, this is a faith in spirit of philosophy w/out dogma, murder, idiotic polemic, hateful distortion) wouldn’t shun/deny double law [i.e. a teacher must initiate/train a student while effacing him/herself in name of autodidactic tradition]
EU.linkedContent: only livable community (for Derrida, this is a faith in spirit of philosophy w/out dogma, murder, idiotic polemic, hateful distortion) wouldn’t shun/deny double law [i.e. a teacher must initiate/train a student while effacing him/herself in name of autodidactic tradition]

EU.content: we need subtle, differentiated work that doesn’t give in to any intimidation
EU.linkedContent: we need subtle, differentiated work that doesn’t give in to any intimidation

EU.content: Derrida mistrusts reactionism against media, says there are not enough media, that the risk w/ media is that it is too monolithic, concentrated, violently uniform
EU.linkedContent: Derrida mistrusts reactionism against media, says there are not enough media, that the risk w/ media is that it is too monolithic, concentrated, violently uniform

EU.content: new philosophical objects, light, permeable, mobile: dispersion, new philosophical “formations”
EU.linkedContent: new philosophical objects, light, permeable, mobile: dispersion, new philosophical “formations”

EU.content: [CIPH] no preinterpretation, “thinking” as what questions philosophy > indeterminate opening (experimental incursions in unexplored areas)
EU.linkedContent: [CIPH] no preinterpretation, “thinking” as what questions philosophy > indeterminate opening (experimental incursions in unexplored areas)
